content.question: Ohmâ€™s law states that if the resistance of the path of current between two points is constant, then the voltage difference <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> between the points and the current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> flowing between the points, measured in amperes, satisfy the relationship <math alttext="V equals, c I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a constant. Which of the following best describes the relationship between the rate of change with respect to time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the voltage and the rate of change with respect to time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the current?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to t, equals, I times the derivative of c, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>I</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>c</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to t, equals, c times the derivative of I, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to I, equals c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 equals, c times the derivative of I, with respect to V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to t, equals, c times the derivative of I, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
